subject: Data
title: Pre-Mortems: Finding Data Flaws Before They Matter
description: A fast breakdown of Pre-Mortems: Finding Data Flaws Before They Matter for builders.

hook.text: Before launching a data project, imagine it failed spectacularly. Now figure out why.

buildup.text: A pre-mortem asks: 'Assume this analysis is completely wrong. What went wrong?' before the work begins.

discovery.text: Psychologist Gary Klein showed pre-mortems increase flaw detection by 30% compared to standard reviews.

twist.text: Post-mortems happen after the damage. Pre-mortems prevent it â€” but few organizations bother.

climax.text: In data analysis, the best time to find errors is before you stake your reputation on the results.

punchline.text: Imagine failure first. Prevent it second.

quiz.question: What is a pre-mortem in data analysis?
options: Reviewing data after a project fails
Imagining failure before starting to identify potential flaws
